TopicTitle: The Official Kerbin Cup Tournament Thread - Final Entries Posted

Articles.Content:
A suggesting regarding having too many teams, mainly for Rowsdower I guess:

Why not let all teams/solo players compete on the first week? If I understood correctly, next weekend we will have the first vote, and one team out of the 4 would be eliminated. Why not just do that with all teams and keep the top 3 for each team (Forum/Reddit)?

That's a brilliant idea, this way at least everyone would to do something. I hope Rowsdower sees it.

It is now almost 15 minutes past the deadline

Time to see who shall be picked.
I do believe I'm going to bed, good night.
Ladys and gentleman May i present to you The A-Team
Folks, the 8pm deadline today was for submitting applications. That's not when the teams will be announced.
Yes please be patient, the teams are now being selected AFAIK. Give some time for the process to work
After all of the community trying to sort this out among them(our)selves, I'm gonna laugh if the the mods select the teams!

Folks, the 8pm deadline today was for submitting applications. That's not when the teams will be announced.

Why didn't you tell us that before?! I was so excited when I went to bed last night...
Are they going to be releasing the first challenge today? That's what I understand from the OP.

Are they going to be releasing the first challenge today? That's what I understand from the OP.

It should be today we will have to wait and see.

It should be today we will have to wait and see.

Yup. Should be something very interesting, knowing the mods here and SQUAD.

I just want to know whether I'm playing or not as I'm not a fan of the system they have in place. Community votes will always be for the most popular people so people like me -new members- won't ever get a real shot at competing.

That stands to reason though. Only a small number of people can compete, so they're going to be selected based on their demonstrated abilities. There's been a bit of time between the announcement and selection for anyone who wants to show off their skills; maybe not enough, but then I'd say the forum teams ought to be made up of people who have a strong record of forum activity.

That stands to reason though. Only a small number of people can compete, so they're going to be selected based on their demonstrated abilities. There's been a bit of time between the announcement and selection for anyone who wants to show off their skills; maybe not enough, but then I'd say the forum teams ought to be made up of people who have a strong record of forum activity.

I actually signed up on Reddit it's hard to keep track of the community on there unless you are like...Scott Manley -harsh example i know- I'd just like to see future tournaments handled a little differently if I'm honest.

I just want to know whether I'm playing or not as I'm not a fan of the system they have in place. Community votes will always be for the most popular people so people like me -new members- won't ever get a real shot at competing.

You are totally correct, most populars will be picked, that's normal and as cantab said, it's based on demostrated abilities.

Anyway, in our team we are 4 modest youtubers, we are not really known by a lot of people, but to counter that, I made a video featuring some of our work in KSP!, and got featured in the official facebook page. That will help us a lot!, and that could help anyone not known enough. The problem is that there was so little time to do so, and I was lucky to have a free saturday (girlfriend was studying) to make the video.

What I mean is: Yes, will be picked by fame, BUT!, you can increase your chances by making yourself visible and showing what you've got!!

good luck everyone!!

I made a video featuring some of our work in KSP!, and got featured in the official facebook page. That will help us a lot!

Yeah I'm pretty sure you guys have nothing to worry about

You are totally correct, most populars will be picked, that's normal and as cantab said, it's based on demostrated abilities.

Anyway, in our team we are 4 modest youtubers, we are not really known by a lot of people, but to counter that, I made a video featuring some of our work in KSP!, and got featured in the official facebook page. That will help us a lot!, and that could help anyone not known enough. The problem is that there was so little time to do so, and I was lucky to have a free saturday (girlfriend was studying) to make the video.

What I mean is: Yes, will be picked by fame, BUT!, you can increase your chances by making yourself visible and showing what you've got!!

good luck everyone!!

I know what I've said can come across as jealousy and hey, maybe in the future we could organise a forum/reddit tournament that isn't official as I've actually got a a lot of experience in tournament making
I'm insanely curious as to what the tasks for the teams to complete are going to be.

I know what I've said can come across as jealousy and hey, maybe in the future we could organise a forum/reddit tournament that isn't official as I've actually got a a lot of experience in tournament making

I was talking to m1 earlier on a similar note. Perhaps after 'official' teams are chosen the forum can take the other teams and run a parallel tourney for fun and rep? I know that our team is going to play along even if we aren't chosen, doing so with other teams would make it even more fun.

I can understand why SQUAD wants to narrow it down, but I also like to see everyone compete and have fun... so this is an idea. *shrugs*

I was talking to m1 earlier on a similar note. Perhaps after 'official' teams are chosen the forum can take the other teams and run a parallel tourney for fun and rep? I know that our team is going to play along even if we aren't chosen, doing so with other teams would make it even more fun.

That's a great idea, I pledge rep to the winners of the informal side tournament.

Only seems fair, I think most of my rep comes from the proximity of the "Give Rep" button to the "Report Post" button.
Quick update - I'm waiting on a few more votes to come in from the mod teams on both sides. Once the results are apparent, I will post up the competitors and the challenges at once.

I can understand why SQUAD wants to narrow it down, but I also like to see everyone compete and have fun... so this is an idea. *shrugs*

I am totally on board with this notion. It would let the community be involved and would overcome some of that exclusion I was on about earlier.

That's a great idea, I pledge rep to the winners of the informal side tournament.

Only seems fair, I think most of my rep comes from the proximity of the "Give Rep" button to the "Report Post" button.

I will also pledge rep if this happens!

I am totally on board with this notion. It would let the community be involved and would overcome some of that exclusion I was on about earlier.

Agreed. I'll definitely help set up such a thing if it winds up happening, and/or if the team I'm on (Team Hype Train! All aboard! ) doesn't get selected for the official competition.

Also, is Scott Manley competing on Reddit, or is he not playing at all? (I'm just surprised he and a few other bigger KSP YouTubers aren't on any of the Forum teams....)

Though Xacktar and his team definetly fill out the YT user category quite well.

Quick update - I'm waiting on a few more votes to come in from the mod teams on both sides. Once the results are apparent, I will post up the competitors and the challenges at once.

Any hints on whether Team Jedi has been selected?
